{"step_by_step_thinking": "The difficulty of removing a material from a patient's mouth depends on its properties. Metallic oxide paste is not typically used in dentistry for impressions, so it's not relevant. Silicone impression material is flexible and easy to remove. Reversible hydrocolloid is also relatively easy to remove because it can change states. Impression plaster, however, hardens and can be difficult to remove without breaking it.", "answer_choice": "D"}
